form.temperatureHelp: Controls randomness (0.0 to 2.0). Leave empty to remove this parameter.
form.maxTokensHelp: Maximum tokens to generate. Leave empty to remove this parameter.
form.maxCompletionTokensHelp: Maximum tokens for completion. Leave empty to remove this parameter.
form.topPHelp: Nucleus sampling parameter (0.0 to 1.0). Leave empty to remove this parameter.
form.frequencyPenaltyHelp: Penalty for frequent tokens (-2.0 to 2.0). Leave empty to remove this parameter.
form.presencePenaltyHelp: Penalty for existing tokens (-2.0 to 2.0). Leave empty to remove this parameter.
form.responseCountHelp: Number of completions to generate. Leave empty to remove this parameter.
form.stopSequenceHelp: Comma-separated stop sequences. Leave empty to remove this parameter.
form.seedHelp: Random seed for reproducible results. Leave empty to remove this parameter.
form.topLogprobsHelp: Number of most likely tokens to return. Leave empty to remove this parameter.
form.timeoutHelp: Request timeout in seconds. Leave empty to remove this parameter.
form.extraBodyHelp: Additional request body parameters in JSON format. Leave empty to remove this parameter.

sidebar.title: Sidebar Navigation
sidebar.content: This is the workspace sidebar, containing quick access to all core functional modules.

agentManager.title: Agent Manager
agentManager.content: Manage your AI agents, configure capabilities and tools. Click to enter the agent management page.

graphEditor.title: Graph Editor
graphEditor.content: Design and execute complex workflow graphs to achieve task automation.

modelManager.title: Model Manager
modelManager.content: Manage and configure multiple AI models from different providers.

systemTools.title: System Tools
systemTools.content: Browse and use built-in system tools to extend agent capabilities.

mcpManager.title: MCP Manager
mcpManager.content: Integrate Model Context Protocol servers to connect external tools and data sources.

promptManager.title: Prompt Manager
promptManager.content: Create and manage prompt templates to optimize AI interactions.

fileManager.title: File Manager
fileManager.content: Manage files and documents generated during conversations.

memoryManager.title: Memory Manager
memoryManager.content: Manage long-term memories for users and agents to improve conversation continuity.

homeButton.title: Back to Chat
homeButton.content: Click the Home button to quickly switch to the chat system page.

mainArea.title: Main Work Area
mainArea.content: This is the main work area, displaying different content and operation interfaces based on the selected functional module.

sidebar.title: Conversation Sidebar
sidebar.content: This is the conversation sidebar, showing all your conversation history for quick switching and management.

newConversation.title: New Conversation
newConversation.content: Click here to start a new conversation.

workspaceButton.title: Go to Workspace
workspaceButton.content: Click here to switch to the workspace to manage agents, models and tools.

mainArea.title: Conversation Area
mainArea.content: This is the main conversation area where you can interact with AI and view message history.

modeSelector.title: Mode Selection
modeSelector.content: Choose Agent mode for intelligent conversation, or Graph mode to execute predefined workflows.

inputArea.title: Input Area
inputArea.content: Enter your message here, configure models, tools and other parameters, then send to start the conversation.

maxIterationsConfig.title: Max Iterations
maxIterationsConfig.description: Set the maximum number of iterations for Agent execution

compactConfigModal.title: Conversation Compact Configuration
compactConfigModal.thresholdHelp: Tool call results exceeding this character count will be summarized by AI
compactConfigModal.preciseDescription: AI intelligently summarizes tool call content while preserving complete conversation structure and context. Suitable for scenarios requiring conversation integrity.
compactConfigModal.brutalDescription: Only keeps user messages and final AI responses per round, significantly reducing conversation length. Suitable for scenarios requiring only core interactions.
compactConfigModal.warning: ⚠️ Compact operation is irreversible. Please confirm that the conversation content does not need to be fully preserved before compacting.

conversationItem.deleteWarning: Are you sure you want to permanently delete this conversation? This action cannot be undone.

mcpToolSelector.title: MCP Tools
mcpToolSelector.goToManager: Please go to MCP Manager to register

addNodeModal.title: Add New Node
addNodeModal.nodeDescriptionPlaceholder: Describe the node's functionality and purpose
addNodeModal.nodeDescriptionTooltip: Used to help AI select appropriate tools and execution strategies
addNodeModal.enableOutputTooltip: Whether to output node response content
addNodeModal.saveFormatTooltip: Format for saving output content to file
addNodeModal.inputNodesTooltip: Select nodes that provide input to this node, including 'start' for user input
addNodeModal.outputNodesTooltip: Select nodes that receive output from this node, including 'end' for final result
addNodeModal.loopCountTooltip: This parameter is used for loop processes. Nodes with redirect count have the ability to change the execution flow. For example, they can check the output of upstream nodes and resend tasks to upstream nodes when conditions are not met. The count determines the maximum number of redirects.
addNodeModal.agentNameTooltip: Select a registered Agent to use its configuration as the node's default configuration
addNodeModal.maxToolCallsTooltip: Limit the maximum number of tool calls for node execution, default is 50
addNodeModal.modelOrAgentRequired: At least one of Model or Agent must be selected
addNodeModal.systemPromptPlaceholder: Enter system prompt, you can reference other nodes with {node_name}
addNodeModal.systemPromptTooltip: System-level prompt to set the behavior and role of the node
addNodeModal.userPromptPlaceholder: Enter user prompt, you can reference other nodes with {node_name}
addNodeModal.userPromptTooltip: User-level prompt for specific task instructions

nodePropertiesPanel.nodeDescriptionPlaceholder: Describe this node's functionality and purpose
nodePropertiesPanel.nodeDescriptionTooltip: Used to help AI select appropriate tools and execution strategies
nodePropertiesPanel.agentTooltip: Select a registered Agent to use its configuration as the node's default configuration
nodePropertiesPanel.inputNodesTooltip: Select nodes that provide input to this node
nodePropertiesPanel.outputNodesTooltip: Select nodes that receive output from this node
nodePropertiesPanel.systemPromptPlaceholder: Enter system prompt, use {node_name} to reference other nodes' output
nodePropertiesPanel.systemPromptTooltip: Type { to quickly insert node reference, like {node_name}
nodePropertiesPanel.userPromptPlaceholder: Enter user prompt, use {node_name} to reference other nodes' output
nodePropertiesPanel.userPromptTooltip: Type { to quickly insert node reference, like {node_name}
nodePropertiesPanel.referenceSyntaxTip1: Type {{ to quickly select a node to reference
nodePropertiesPanel.referenceSyntaxTip3: Use {{node_name}} to reference other nodes' output
nodePropertiesPanel.referenceSyntaxTip4: Use {{@prompt_name}} to reference registered prompt templates
nodePropertiesPanel.referenceSyntaxTip5: Support combined references: {{node1:3|node2:2}} to get interleaved output from multiple nodes
nodePropertiesPanel.executionLevelTooltip: Lower numbers execute first, used to control node execution order
nodePropertiesPanel.loopCountTooltip: This parameter is used for loop processes. Nodes with redirect count have the ability to change the execution flow. For example, they can check the output of upstream nodes and resend tasks to upstream nodes when conditions are not met. The count determines the maximum number of redirects.
nodePropertiesPanel.maxIterationsTooltip: Limit the maximum number of iterations for node execution, default is 10
nodePropertiesPanel.saveFormatTooltip: Format for saving output content to file

versionManager.title: Version Manager
versionManager.pageDescription: Create version snapshot for current graph configuration, for tracking change history and version rollback
versionManager.noVersions: No version history yet, click "New Version" button above to save current configuration
versionManager.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this version?
versionManager.unsavedChangesMessage: Current graph has unsaved changes. Loading a version will overwrite these changes. Continue?
versionManager.commitMessageMinLength: Commit message must be at least 5 characters
versionManager.commitMessagePlaceholder: Describe the main changes in this version, e.g., added data processing node, optimized prompts, fixed connection errors, etc.
versionManager.tip1: Commit message should clearly describe the main changes in this version
versionManager.tip2: Version will save the complete graph configuration
versionManager.tip3: If there are unsaved changes, they will be automatically saved first
